did.head: Descriptive Summary

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Margaret Haley Carpenter Papers, 1898-1985, Accession # 10656, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was received as a gift, in memory of Margaret Haley Carpenter, from Nan Cooke Carpenter and Kathleen Carpenter Wine on July 3, 1985.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts, proofs, correspondence, illustrations, and reviews for Miss Carpenter's books Sara Teasdale: A Biography; Reflections of an era: letters to Sara Teasdale; Anthology of Magazine Verse(edited with William Stanley Braithwaite); The Virginia Author's Yearbook;and A Gift for the Princess of Springtime.

Major topics in her papers include Sara Teasdale (for whom she collected transcriptions of over 760 letters) and William S. Braithwaite; as well as Edna St. Vincent Millay, Emily Dickinson, Ezra Pound, and Vachel Lindsay; her work as an author, biographer and editor; the literary efforts of her correspondents; the Poetry Society of America and the Poetry Society of Virginia.

Also included are college correspondence courses in music; poetry in general; reviews; Virginia authors; and the Smith family including account books, correspondence, clippings, photographs, and financial papers, 1910-1958, particularly the record of children delivered by William Tilden Smith, M.D.

There are also files of correspondence, manuscripts, memorabilia and other material assembled by Joy Gerbaulet, Floyd Dell, George Dillon, Robert Frost, Josephine Johnson (including letters from servicemen in World War I and II), Julia Johnson Davis and David Morton; and photographs of over thirty noted authors.
